current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to carry out
		  a demonstration project to assess the feasibility and advisability of using
		  State and local government agencies and nonprofit organizations to increase
		  awareness of benefits and services for veterans and to improve coordination of
		  outreach activities relating to such benefits and services, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Demonstration project
			 to increase coordination of outreach efforts between the Department of Veterans
			 Affairs and Federal, State, and local agencies and nonprofit
			 organizations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry
			 out a demonstration project to assess the feasibility and advisability of using
			 State and local government agencies and nonprofit organizations—

text.#text: The

to increase
			 awareness of veterans regarding benefits and services for veterans; and

and Federal, State, and local government and nonprofit

to improve
			 coordination of outreach activities regarding such benefits and services

The demonstration project shall be carried out during the
			 two-year period beginning on the date that is 180 days after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.

may extend the duration of the

In

unless that State agrees that, with respect to the costs to be

			 grant was awarded, the State will make available (directly or through donations
			 from public or private entities) non-Federal contributions in an amount equal
			 to 50 percent of Federal funds provided under the grant.
